result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:41 PM Defendant MARY A SCHMIDT in court.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, penalties, and rights. Defendant would like an atty and does not qualify for PD appointment. Defendant presents Appointment of Counsel Report. M. Schmidt sworn and questioned by Court. Court does not find Defendant indigent. Court will give Defendant more time to determine options.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
